alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alamance and northeastern Guilford Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Monroeton, or 9 miles north of Greensboro, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, McLeansville, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Stokesdale, Altamahaw-Ossipee, Lake Townsend Marina, Lake Townsend, Altamahaw and Monticello. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
